nothing exists here, but we make so much noise to hear about it! what a rush to write! makes me feel like i'm, i'm, i'm, i'm, like it's summer, i guess people call it spring. dangerous nostalgia: bangkok dangerous. i'm listening to isle of the cheetah. nothing ever happened! if i believe that my blocks and ignorance are self imposed, and non-existent to boot, then, then i should be able to write, something, that brings me great joy, for no reason whatsoever! i have fingers i i have fingers i i have fingers to move to move to do things that have nothing to do with eating, and that touching is forgotten, but needn't be, but still how bizarre that touching is not the point! i am pushing for the purpose of writing for the purpose of feeling for the purpose of total deconstruction of a sense of self for the purpose... for no purpose! for no purpose!

~renunciation~ comes on its own when mindfulness-wisdom (awareness-acceptance) is [bravely, brazenly] brought to clinging or craving. interest develops, and the clinging, which <u>obscured</u> what the heart/mind really wants (and is), is revealed and reveals.

we self-liberate (wisdom does the work)

rest. you are no <u>more</u> loving, compass[ionate], joyous, or equ[animous] than before

all greed/craving/clinging and aversion is inherently delusional, based on the false assumption of the existence of self.

we cling to:

sense pleasures
views ("my partner should be like this...")
personality views ("i am now this, now this")
rules and rituals

things are as they are
(things are as they aren't?)

when someone else is having a difficult experience, the <s>correct</s> natural response is not trying/wanting to make it different, or getting angry that they are "doing it wrong" (<u>or</u> delusion that their suffering is separate from you)... but is compassion /for them/ for yourself

neither by philosophical views, holy acts, tradition, knowledge, virtue, nor by not having these, does one know/prove purity. they just wander the world, annoying people.

[ed. full quote: "After investigation, there is nothing among all doctrines that (an awakened being) would embrace. Not by any philosophical opinion, not by tradition, not by knowledge, not by virtue and holy works can anyone say that purity exists; nor by absence of philosophical opinion, by absence of tradition, by absence of knowledge, by absence of virtue and holy works either; having abandoned these without adopting anything else, let one, calm and independent, not de-sire any resting place.  One who thinks oneself equal to others, or superior, or inferior, for that very reason disputes; but one who is unmoved under those three conditions, for that person the notions 'equal,' 'superior,' and 'inferior' do not exist. The Sage for whom the notions 'equal' and 'unequal' do not exist, would he say, 'This is true'?  Or with whom should he dispute, saying, 'This is false?' With whom should he enter into dispute? An accomplished person does not by a philosophical view or by thinking become arrogant, for he is not of that sort; not by holy works, nor by tradition is he led, he is not led into any of the resting places of the mind. For one who is free from views there are no ties, for one who is delivered by understanding there are no follies; but those who grasp after views and philosophical opinions, they wander about in the world annoying people."  The Buddha]

<u>when to give, when to practice Generosity (season for giving)</u>
1. when someone arrives (seeing someone)
2. when someone leaves (saying goodbye)
3. when one is ill
4. when there is famine (or in times of poverty)
5. when it does not adversely affect the recipient <u>nor</u> the giver

<u>be generous face to face, unembarrassed</u>
remember thanksgiving at spirit rock
give 1/2 a sandwich

-buddha (potential for awakening, in every moment)
-dhamma (truth, goodness)
-sangha
-one's own past virtue (sila)
-one's own past generosity (dana) or sometimes another's
-the devas (?)

What Power art thou,
Who from below,
Hast made me rise,
Unwillingly and slow,
From beds of everlasting snow!

See'st thou not how stiff,
And wondrous old,
Far unfit to bear the bitter cold.

I can scarcely move,
Or draw my breath,
I can scarcely move,
Or draw my breath.

Let me, let me,
Let me, let me,
Freeze again...
Let me, let me,
Freeze again to death!

-klaus nomi

In early times in Japan, bamboo-and-paper lanterns were used with candles inside. A blind man, visiting a friend one night, was offered a lantern to carry home with him. 

"I do not need a lantern," he said. "Darkness or light is all the same to me."

"I know you do not need a lantern to find your way," his friend replied, "but if you don't have one, someone else may run into you. So you must take it."

The blind man started off with the lantern and before he had walked very far someone ran squarely into him. "Look out where you are going!" he exclaimed to the stranger. "Can't you see this lantern?" 

"Your candle has burned out, brother," replied the stranger.


--Paul Reps, in Zen Flesh, Zen Bones

Theres a Zen story in which a man is enjoying himself on a river at dusk. He sees another boat coming down the river toward him. At first it seems so nice to him that someone else is also enjoying the river on a nice summer evening. Then he realizes that the boat is coming right toward him, faster and faster. He begins to get upset and starts to yell, Hey, hey watch out! For Petes sake, turn aside! But the boat just comes faster and faster, right toward him. By this time hes standing up in his boat, screaming and shaking his fist, and then the boat smashes right into him. He sees that its an empty boat. 

This is the classic story of our whole life situation.

--Pema Chdrn, Start Where You Are

so i'm house- and dog- sitting at this cool house upcounty from spirit rock right now, and the only thing that will get this dog to stop moping is when i play the harmonica. it's incredible, she gets right up and starts listening and smiling and licking whatever part of me is closest. eventually i just climbed under the table with her and played until i worried the downstairs residents were getting annoyed. and then i stopped worrying and played until i had a headache (not used to playing as all my harmonicas are back in mass, this one a friend just lent me). good dog!

oglomendatariomania!!

The first noble truth says simply that it's part of being human to feel discomfort. We don't even have to call it suffering anymore; we dont even have to call it discomfort. It's simply coming to know the fireyness of fire, the wildness of wind, the turbulence of water, the upheaval of earth, as well as the warmth of fire, the coolness and smoothness of water, the gentleness of the breezes, and the goodness, solidness, and dependability of the earth. Nothing in its essence is one way or the other. The four elements take on different qualities; they're like magicians. Sometimes they manifest in one form and sometimes in another.... The first noble truth recognizes that we also change like the weather, we ebb and flow like the tides, we wax and wane like the moon. --Pema Chodron, Awakening Loving-Kindness

i have been having dreams

i have been having dreams about hanging out with all of you and doing regular things. last night, me josh and justin played video games, for a few hours. in my dreams. waking up, i remembered that the night before, me and my little brother walked around and talked about stuff, and i chilled in the house with da family. i am sure i have been dreaming about all of you, all of YOU, too. the main difference in this dreams is that everyone is real people (no composites) and everything is really ordinary and satisfying until i begin to wake up when things get strained and one situation starts to loop, and i'm caught between the desire to stay asleep and the calmness that the dream world has given up to conscious shared reality world, where there is wind always in the distance like the ocean through the trees the hills and crunching and cups rattling here, nearby, here. 

i guess i just miss my friend(S). and video games... and... maybe bowling or something. and things that are arbitrary.
and MDMA. and not MDMA, really. and parties that i hardly ever had fun at, but sometimes i would have a lot of fun at when my body was comfortable and my charm was thriving. worlds that live in my head, and sometimes in facebook pictures that i see but don't envy, but then quietly dream about . don't worry, the days are getting longer and we are all being reborn.

it is too late and sleepy to erase that and write something else, and i
have buried all the kind things i wanted to say to you in the vibrating
places woven into the inner senses of a river of me. by my knees, encoded
by feeling i am telling you things that make you feel quiet, in airy
pockets of breath beneath this heart-space the missouri sky is baring its
lonliness for you to see the deep soil of communion with beat, with all
things, on a field in where the breeze gathers the heat from your body.
the palms of my hands say nothing because they are holding whole the
world, and the whole world is holding me, and most of me is thinking about
you, or more likely of all these things that are not you, but which gladly
accept, in your absence, the things i could not keep to myself.

"you are a good dude. meet me in bed or in a chair."

adam
